greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of Product_{k>=1} ((1 + 3*x^k) / (1 + x^k)).
comment: In general, for m > 0, if g.f. = Product_{k>=1} ((1 + m*x^k) / (1 + x^k)) then a(n) ~ c^(1/4) * exp(sqrt(c*n)) / (2*sqrt((m+1)*Pi) * n^(3/4)),  where c = Pi^2/3 + 2*log(m)^2 + 4*polylog(2, -1/m).
link: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
results.author: _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 06 2016
